title: Understanding PivotTable and PivotChart
text: PivotTables and PivotCharts are tools in Excel that allow you to summarize and visualize data. They are interconnected, meaning changes in one can affect the other.

title: Removing Fields from PivotTable
text: To remove a field from a PivotTable, you can drag the field out of the values area in the PivotTable Field List.

title: Removing Fields from PivotChart
text: Similarly, to remove a field from a PivotChart, you can drag the field out of the values area in the PivotChart Field List.

hintAnswer: remove the field from both by dragging the field out of the values area
title: Removing Fields from Both
text: To remove fields from both the PivotTable and PivotChart, drag the field out of the values area in both the PivotTable and PivotChart Field Lists.
choices: delete it manually from PivotTable, then PivotChart
remove the field from both by dragging the field out of the values area
remove the field from PivotTable, then PivotChart
remove the field from PivotChart, then PivotTable
